intro: Oxydectes microcarpa, commonly known as the small-fruited dandelion, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in grasslands and open habitats, thriving in well-drained soils. Its small, yellow flowers develop into fluffy white seed heads, which are dispersed by the wind. Oxydectes microcarpa is often found in arid or semi-arid regions, showing adaptability to dry conditions.
